intro: Bothriocline monticola, commonly known as the mountain thistle, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, dry conditions. Its leaves are generally spiny and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a dense cluster. Bothriocline monticola plays a role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a habitat for small invertebrates.
